title: Classifying Fano 4-folds with a rational fibration onto a 3-fold
abstract:
We study smooth, complex Fano 4-folds X with a rational contraction onto a
3-fold, namely a rational map X-->Y that factors as a sequence of flips X-->X'
followed by a surjective morphism X'->Y with connected fibers, where Y is
normal, projective, and dim Y=3. We show that if X has a rational contraction
onto a 3-fold and X is not a product of del Pezzo surfaces, then the Picard
number rho(X) of X is at most 9; this bound is sharp. As an application, we
show that every Fano 4-fold X with rho(X)=12 is isomorphic to a product of
surfaces, thus improving the result by the first named author that shows the
same for rho(X)>12. We also give a classification result for Fano 4-folds X,
not products of surfaces, having a "special" rational contraction X-->Y with
dim Y=3, rho(X)-rho(Y)=2, and rho(X)>6; we show that there are only three
possible families. Then we prove that the first family exists if rho(X)=7, and
that the second family exists if and only if rho(X)=7. This provides the first
examples of Fano 4-folds with rho(X)>6 different from products of del Pezzo
surfaces and from the Fano models of the blow-up of P^4 in points. We also
construct three new families with rho(X)=6. Finally we show that if a Fano
4-fold X has Lefschetz defect delta(X)=2, then rho(X) is at most 6; this bound
is again sharp.
